Although we think the formation of the MLP was the right move strategically, sustained low oil prices have resulted in energy producers scaling back drilling activity.
As a result, we have reduced our expected earnings and cash distribution growth from Enable.
Economic Moat eleven/twenty/two thousand fifteen We are reaffirming our narrow moat.
For the most part, state regulators have recognized the need for shareholders to earn an adequate return on investment.
In exchange for earning a fair return for its shareholders, CenterPoint's utilities are expected to provide safe and reliable service at the lowest possible rates.

This implicit contract between regulators and capital providers should, on balance, allow CenterPoint's regulated utilities to earn above their costs of capital, though observable returns might vary in the short run based on demand trends, investment cycles,
CenterPoint is concentrating its growth expenditure in jurisdictions with favorable regulatory frameworks.
At Houston Electric, CenterPoint's largest business unit, the utility has automatic rate recovery mechanisms for approximately ninety five percent of its capital plan.
The company's six natural gas distribution businesses also have favorable regulatory frameworks for the most part.
In Texas, home to its largest gas distribution system, the Gas Reliability Infrastructure Program, or GRIP, allows annual filings for incremental capital investments.
In Minnesota's traditional regulatory framework, utilities can implement interim rates sixty days after filing a rate request and the regulatory framework has been good to date.

Although we don't believe Enable Midstream Partners' unregulated businesses possess an economic moat, CenterPoint's ownership position in the partnership contributes only about twenty percent of consolidated net income.
Thus, we don't believe Enable's no moat businesses contribute enough to consolidated earnings and cash flow to dilute CenterPoint's narrow economic moat.

Valuation three/four/two thousand sixteen We are cutting our fair value estimate to dollar twenty one from dollar twenty two per share following the recent reduction in CenterPoint's outlook for utility investments in its updated five year plan.
In addition, we now expect Enable's cash distributions to be flat over the next five years due to depressed commodity prices in the midstream business.
The reduced utility investment outlook and our expectations of lower cash distributions from Enable were partially offset by time value appreciation.

With favorable Texas regulation and a flat but historically high level of capital expenditures, we estimate Houston Electric's operating income will grow approximately six percent annually during the next five years.
We assume transmission right ofway revenue falls from around dollar thirty million per year in two thousand thirteen to about dollar three million per year on a normalized basis.
We estimate annual operating income growth at the natural gas distribution segment during the next five years will also average over eight percent, driven by rate base growth.
The rate base growth is due in large part to upgrading gas transmission and distribution piping for safety, including the ongoing dollar four hundred million Minnesota Belt Line Project.
We assume a nine percent cost of equity, in line with the rate of return we expect investors to demand of a diversified equity portfolio.

We also value CenterPoint using a sum of the parts analysis.
Based on Enable's dollar six.eighty five per unit market price in early March, CenterPoint's ownership interest represents about dollar four per CenterPoint share.
Our fair value estimate implies a value on CenterPoint's utilities of dollar seventeen per share, or nineteen times two thousand seventeen earnings.

This level is above the average multiple for peers, but we think it is justified, owing to strong customer growth in Houston and favorable regulatory frameworks for the company's natural gas utilities.
Risk eleven/twenty/two thousand fifteen Regulatory risk is key since the majority of operating earnings are from businesses that are state regulated.
That said, CenterPoint's regulatory exposure is diversified because of operations in six state jurisdictions.
In addition, Enable derives about half of its earnings from transmission pipelines regulated by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
The FERC tends to be less influenced by political agendas than state regulatory bodies, and typically has a more constructive regulatory framework.
This usually provides more transparent and predictable regulatory decisions and higher allowed return on equity for transmission operations.

CenterPoint has reduced some of the regulatory uncertainty for its natural gas distribution investments related to safety and reliability by receiving preapproval and favorable rate mechanis Miss As an example, CenterPoint's gas distribution utility in Texas has a GRIP rate tracker mechanism between rate cases.
CenterPoint also has weather normalization adjustments in Arkansas, Louisiana, Oklahoma, and Mississippi, along with a recently approved usage decoupling pilot program in Minnesota.
Another risk reducing regulatory framework is that all Houston Electric customers are served under marketbased tariffs, eliminating all commodity risk.
However, Texas regulation has historically been contentious, with Texas Public Utility Commission decisions frequently ending up in court.

Enable's investments in nonregulated pipelines and natural gas processing facilities have higher return potential but increased earnings risk because they do not have monopoly status or preset returns.
Management eleven/twenty/two thousand fifteen We assign CenterPoint a Standard stewardship rating.
The management team has done a respectable job of working with state regulators to enact favorable mechanisms that reduce regulatory lag.
Furthermore, we like that the management team has earmarked the vast majority of capital spending to regulated operations, where returns are largely known and operating risks are low.
In addition, we believe the two thousand thirteen decision to move the interstate pipelines and field services businesses into an MLP demonstrates good stewardship of shareholder capital.
Although depressed commodity prices have reduced the premium valuation that MLPs have once enjoyed, they continue to receive favorable tax treatment that benefits shareholders.

Prochazka had been the company's chief operating officer and has been with CenterPoint since two thousand one.

The company has natural gas distribution systems in six states, including the cities of Houston and Minneapolis.

CenterPoint owns approximately fifty five percent of Enable Midstream Partners, a partnership consisting of natural gas processing and storage facilities and more than twenty one thousand miles of interstate, intrastate, and gathering pipelines in the midcontinent region.

Investment Thesis // Canadian Natural Resources is an independent energy company engaged in upstream operations, coupled with the ownership of midstream pipeline assets.
The company focuses on the acquisition, development, production, marketing, and sale of crude oil, natural gas, and NGLs.
CNQ operates in western Canada, the U.K. sector of the North Sea, and Offshore Africa.

CNQ's ownership of midstream pipeline assets allows the company to control the transport of a significant portion of its own production and lowers the company's transportation expenses and overall cost structure.
Even with a low cost structure, CNQ still faces an uphill struggle coping with lower oil prices.
Depressed realized prices have forced capital spending cuts, stalling the future growth potential of CNQ's oil sands assets.
Consequently, CNQ's Primrose, Kirby, and Grouse oil sands expansion projects have been put on hold and face an uncertain time horizon.
Nevertheless, Canadian Natural continues to invest in expansion at its Horizon mining and upgrading project.
We expect and capital spending to greatly exceed operating cash flow, requiring the company to take on additional debt.
As a result, we expect a large boost in financial leverage from its current level, coupled with potential liquidity concerns.
Despite this, CNQ's future oil sands projects could drive significant growth in a better oil price environment.
However, these projects aren't economic with crude prices entrenched at current levels, so the timing of any expansion is highly uncertain.
Therefore, we believe that the market is putting too much emphasis on CNQ's growth prospects and is overlooking CNQ's balance sheet risks.
Economic Moat // Moats are established by firms with durable competitive advantages that enable them to earn sustainable excess returns on capital.
They are not cyclical and severe commodity price headwinds do not preclude bestinclass operators from earning moat ratings if they can still generate significant value in the long run.
The competitive advantage of E and P firms largely stems from the quality of their acreage.

Longrun oil and gas prices are set by the marginal cost of extraction, so the ability to earn excess returns depends on the position of each firm's assets on the appropriate cost curve, as well as the ultimate price received for the firm's production .

Significant future resource potential is also a vital component of our moat framework because firms with limited lowcost drilling opportunities will be unable to supplant declining production without eroding their profitability.

Investment Thesis one/seven/two thousand sixteen As a result of bold acquisitions and organic expansion, Capital One has evolved from a monoline credit card company to a diversified holding company offering a broad spectrum of financial products and services to consumers and businesses.
Capital One can be generally divided into three segmentscredit cards, consumer banking, and commercial bankingall of which have been supplemented by acquisition and subsequently grown organically.

In the past, we were impressed by the consumer and commercial lending growth as improvement in the overall economy took place in two thousand fourteen and two thousand fifteen.

More recently, we continue to expect the credit card business to continue its growth trajectory and serve as the catalyst for balance sheet growth, which should help stabilize net interest margins as higheryielding assets are added to the loan portfolio.

In the past, Capital One's strategy has been defined by the bank's large and bold risks with shareholder capital through potentially risky acquisitions in an effort to transform itself into a fullservice bank.

The most recent example is Capital One's intention to acquire dollar eight.five billion in loans related to healthcare equipment and providers from General Electric Capital as the latter company exits the business.

Management continues to be focused on building shareholder value by growing diverse businesses into a unified bank that serves its customers well, maintains strong expense controls, and produces resilient and attractive riskadjusted returns.
So far, we see evidence that management is up to the task, and we think shareholders will reap the rewards.

Economic Moat one/seven/two thousand sixteen We think Capital One has a narrow moat that stems in part from the bank's position as a leading credit card issuer in the concentrated U.S. credit card market.
In competing with other issuers, the firm has the scale and breadth to spread its risk across the country and use its advertising spending efficiently.
Furthermore, it has the ability to change offerings and prices based on local conditions and demand.
In addition, the sticky relationship between card issuer and customer is beneficial to Capital One's economic moat because it creates switching costs.
In its localized banking operations, Capital One has benefited from its lowcost deposit base, giving it a competitive advantage in pricing its loan products.
With low longterm rates, Capital One has been able to price loans competitively while still earning an attractive net interest margin.
After the acquisition of ING Direct's online operations, Capital One established itself as a leading online banker in the U.S., a move that we think helps preserve its overall moat.
The transaction improved Capital One's liquidity and solidified its funding base, which will help win loan business with competitive pricing.
Eventually, more online funding could lessen the need for expensive branches, which would help Capital One's overall cost structure.

Analyst Note three/fourteen/two thousand sixteen Cabot Oil and Gas announced on March ten that it now expects a second half two thousand seventeen in service date for the Constitution Pipeline revised from year end two thousand sixteen based on continued delays in receiving water quality permits from the state of New York.

As a reminder, once in service, Constitution will carry five hundred million cubic feet per day of Cabot's Pennsylvania Marcellus production approximately thirty percent of the company's current natural gas volumes to more favorably priced markets in New York and New England.

Prior to the announced delay, we had been conservatively forecasting that Cabot would increase two thousand sixteen and two thousand seventeen gas production by one percent and five percent, respectively.

As a result, we don't expect any meaningful impact to our projected production volumes or cash flows after incorporating the delayed in service date, nor do we anticipate any meaningful impact to our current fair value estimate of dollar thirty six.
Cabot's balance sheet should also remain in good shape, and we retain our narrow moat rating.

Investment Thesis one/twenty/two thousand sixteen Cabot Oil and Gas' crown jewel is its two hundred thousand net acre position in Susquehanna County, Pennsylvania, where the firm has been targeting the lower Marcellus horizon.
Cabot was among the first movers when it began leasing here in two thousand five and has since become the dominant acreage holder in the county.
Cabot's Susquehanna leasehold is among the most productive in North America, characterized by significant resources in place, high recovery factors, and overpressured source rock.
Low royalty rates and contiguous acreage help keep costs low, while longer term leases reduce the pressure to drill.
Pipelinequality gas further reduces costs by minimizing the need for processing.

Construction and permitting for gathering, compression, and takeaway infrastructure have served as a bottleneck on production, although the firm's recently established partnership with Williams has helped it better keep pace with drilling activity.

The company is now in full development mode in Susquehanna County although efficiency gains are still likely to be made, in part through the use of fit for purpose rigs and pad drilling and ongoing acreage consolidation.

We forecast five hundred forty net wells turned to sales over the next five years, with net production growing from one.five billion cubic feet per day in the fourth quarter of two thousand fourteen to two.six bcf/d by year end two thousand twenty, representing compound annual growth of eleven percent .
We estimate that the firm will have worked through one fourth of its inventory over this time.
We project the Marcellus will account for about ninety percent of Cabot's production over the next several years.
The company's other area of focus is the black oil window of the Eagle Ford Shale in south Texas.
Cabot established its Eagle Ford position in early two thousand ten and today holds eighty nine thousand net acres at relatively low cost.
The company is partnered with EOG across a small portion of its acreage here.
We forecast a drilling program of two hundred forty net wells through two thousand twenty, with production
COG : Cabot Oil and Gas Corp Class A Analyst Report
increasing to thirty four thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day, or seven percent of total company volumes.
We estimate another five years of remaining drilling inventory at the end of our forecast period.
Economic Moat one/twenty/two thousand sixteen The competitive advantage of E and P firms largely stems from the quality of their assets.
In particular, we consider the rates of return of wells drilled on the company's acreage as well as the number of potential drilling locations remaining.
The former depends on the productivity of the well as well as the cost of drilling and operating it.
Hydrocarbon flow rates are primarily a function of the underlying geology, but the company's completion methodology will also have an impact.
Typically, more aggressive completion techniques will boost productivity but at a greater cost; management will seek to optimize these variables to maximize return.
Other factors influencing the cost of a well include drilling cost, royalty rates, leasehold outlays, production taxes, and lifting expenses.
Asset quality is measured along three dimensions: resource potential, per unit production costs, and realized prices .
We rate Cabot positively along each of these dimensions and accordingly assign the firm a narrow moat rating.
Cabot holds more than two decades of drilling opportunities across the Marcellus Shale formation, primarily in Susquehanna County.

This dry gas acreage is characterized by low operating and development costs, the potential to develop multiple productive horizons, and, based on planned infrastructure buildout over the next few years, sufficient midstream capacity to bring production to market.

As an early mover and sizable operator in this region, Cabot benefits from reasonable royalty rates, fairly blocked up acreage positions, and established relationships with service providers and midstream partners.

Elsewhere in its portfolio, Cabot's Eagle Ford shale position, while still early in its development, should ultimately help diversify the firm's production mix away from natural gas and provide a nice boost to economics.

We estimate Cabot's fully loaded two thousand fifteen cash break even costs to be approximately dollar two.fifty one per thousand cubic feet at dollar fifty per barrel oil trending to less than dollar one.fifty

per mcf over the next several years as oil prices improve and forecast average adjusted returns on capital of twelve percent through two thousand nineteen, trending from negative four percent in two thousand fourteen to around thirty percent by two thousand nineteen as a result of improving natural gas price realizations, more favorable oil prices, and a maturing production base.

Valuation one/twenty one/two thousand sixteen After updating our oil and gas strip prices to reflect the most recent downward move in these curves, we are reducing our fair value estimate for Cabot by dollar four per share, to dollar thirty six.
Our fair value estimate implies two thousand sixteen and two thousand seventeen enterprise value/EBITDAX multiples of around twenty four and ten times, respectively.
Our fair value estimate is based on a bottom up analysis starting with a single well profile and aggregating cash flows
COG : Cabot Oil and Gas Corp Class A Analyst Report
We also perform an assessment of trading multiples, comparable transactions, and longer term resource potential.

We forecast aggregate net production of one thousand six hundred eighty two mmcfe/d in two thousand fifteen, one thousand six hundred forty one mmcfe/d in two thousand sixteen, and one thousand eight hundred eighteen mmcfe/d in two thousand seventeen, representing an eight percent compound annual growth rate over two thousand fourteen.

In the Marcellus, we forecast volumes to increase six percent by two thousand seventeen to one thousand six hundred fifty one mmcfe/d, supported by ongoing infrastructure buildout in northeast Pennsylvania.
In the Eagle Ford, we expect production to reach twenty mboe/d by two thousand seventeen, up from near zero in two thousand ten.
We expect natural gas will constitute around ninety three percent of Cabot's production volumes during the next five years.

We project an average reserve replacement ratio of two hundred fifty percent through two thousand eighteen, with proved reserves climbing from seven.four tcfe in two thousand fourteen to ten.six tcfe by two thousand eighteen.

We forecast EBITDAX of dollar seven hundred eighty three million in two thousand fifteen, dollar three hundred sixty five million in two thousand sixteen, and dollar nine hundred ten million in two thousand seventeen, driven primarily by production growth as well as improving oil prices and natural gas price realizations.
Average projected margins are likely to be less than Cabot's ten year historical average of sixty five percent .

Risk one/twenty/two thousand sixteen As with most E and P firms, a sustained and significant drop in oil and natural gas prices would hurt Cabot's profitability and reduce cash flow available for growth.
Other risks to keep an eye on include service cost inflation as oil prices recover, regulatory headwinds, midstream constraints, and uncertainty regarding future state and federal tax policy.
Management one/twenty/two thousand sixteen Cabot is led by chairman, president, and CEO Dan Dinges, who has held these roles since two thousand two.

Dinges and his management team have generally taken good care of shareholders over the years, employing a conservative approach that has helped minimize franchise risk while profitably increasing production and reserves.

We applaud management's decision to preserve capital during the two thousand nine downturn which ran contrary to what a number of other operators did at the time and give it a lot of credit for the moves it's made since, including noncore asset sales and aggressive expansion into liquids rich plays, such as the Eagle Ford.
Combined, we think these moves position the company for continued strong performance in the years ahead.
Cabot's directors and officers own approximately two percent of the outstanding common shares of the company.
On the whole, executive compensation appears reasonable and includes a mix of base pay, bonuses, and performance based long term incentives.

Analyst Note one/twenty six/two thousand sixteen Coach's second quarter results point to steady progress in its brand reset and its long run potential in underdeveloped international markets such as China and Europe.

Although North American same store sales remained slightly negative, sequential improvement quarter to quarter, positive comparable sales growth in renovated stores, and a continued reduction of reliance on promotions are positive indicators for the Coach brand, in our view, which drives our narrow moat rating.

With results in line with our long run forecast, we will make no changes to our dollar forty five fair value estimate and note that even with the bump in price after the earnings announcement, we consider shares undervalued.
In the quarter that ended Dec. thirty one, net sales rose four percent to dollar one.twenty
This marks a return to growth after ten quarters of sales declines.
North American sales of the Coach brand declined seven percent to dollar seven hundred thirty one million, or six percent in constant currency.

Adjusting for store closures, reduced promotions, and fewer online sales, Coach's retail same store sales were down just three percent and wholesale sales down midsingle digits, in line with guidance.
International sales rose four percent to dollar four hundred thirty seven million, or an even more solid nine percent excluding the strong dollar.

Despite ongoing weakness across the luxury retail sector affecting Hong Kong and Macau, total China sales were up two percent, or five percent in constant currency, and comparable store sales were positive on double digit total growth on the mainland.
Comparable store sales in Europe grew double digits, although management did call out a noticeable impact in France after the November Paris attacks but didn't give further details.
Japan sales rose two percent in constant currencies and despite two store closures, but declined three percent on a reported basis.
All in, after a number of puts and takes, management raised guidance slightly, but there is little impact on our long run growth forecast of about six percent.

Investment Thesis eight/twenty seven/two thousand fifteen Coach has developed a narrow economic moat through a brand that enables pricing, sourcing and distribution advantages, and capital efficiency.
Despite the company's recent struggles, it is still creating economic profits, and at a level greater than many lifestyle brands.
Attention to capital efficiency and consumers' strong brand loyalty have been key drivers of Coach's economic returns.
We judge brand to be more important in bags and leather accessories than other soft goods categories as consumers tend to be more brand loyal.
Despite Coach's long run plans to increase penetration in footwear and ready to wear, we believe accessories will remain the core of the business.
The men's business also offers some upside; it recently constituted around sixteen percent of sales.
Coach's international business is still underdeveloped and represents an opportunity if growth there can continue for the long run.
Although recent fiscal struggles highlight Coach's market concentration in North America, using long run success in Japan as a guide, we think there is plenty of room for Coach to take
In Japan, Coach has had flat to low single digit growth for the past ten years while competitors generally have experienced declines.
The company entered Europe in two thousand twelve through department store partnerships and is now penetrating further wholesale accounts and opening retail stores.
We believe there is room for a brand such as Coach offering uniquely American styles and high quality products at lower price points.
In China, Coach lags other luxury brands with respect to sales, but has greater growth potential.
The company increased its China business to more than dollar one hundred million in two thousand ten and expects approximately dollar six hundred ten million in fiscal two thousand sixteen.
Coach should also see higher operating margins in China as it expands because of lower operating costs and higher gross margins.

In Europe, where Coach has just a small number of boutiques and is developing dedicated shops in department stores, the company should leverage selling, general, and administrative expenses over time, with sales of about dollar one hundred twenty six million expected in fiscal two thousand sixteen despite the strong US dollar.

Economic Moat eight/twenty seven/two thousand fifteen While Coach might not have complete pricing power because of the price/value equation inherent at some level in consumers' decision to purchase its mid tier luxury offerings, the company's ability to design, distribute, and source has historically enabled it to produce high operating margins.
Coach's gross margins, and gross margin return on investment are among the best in our coverage list, lending evidence that the firm has some pricing power in the range where it competes.

Despite the short term adverse fashion cycle, and in addition to the mistake of overpromoting online, we believe the Coach brand to be valuable and believe the company will again be able to return to high operating margins, which should drive returns on capital back into the mid or even high twentys.
Thus, in our opinion, Coach's brand and premium pricing warrant a narrow economic moat.

Brand history and the extensive, directly operated, and wholesale distribution network also contribute to the defensibility of the position, in our thinking, and although currently in a reinvestment phase, the revamping and refurbishment of the network only serve to reinforce the brand image and solidify the economic moat.
Our viewpoint is supported by returns on capital that have averaged over forty percent before fiscal two thousand thirteen.
Operating margins have averaged above thirty percent in the past, and despite shortterm declines, we believe they can again reach the mid twenty percent range during our ten year forecast period.
Valuation ten/twenty seven/two thousand fifteen Our fair value estimate remains dollar forty five per share after we have updated our model for the second fiscal quarter two thousand sixteen.

Management has maintained guidance for high double digit operating margins, low singledigit top line growth before exchange headwinds and the addition of Stuart Weitzman, and for Coach brand comparable store sales to turn positive by yearend.
